body_html:
As far as I understand msvcp140.dll is a 'generic' library (iostream, containers, etc.) So it won't be needed if the project was built using MinGW, for example.
Alternatively (if you prefer to stick to MS VC++ compiler) you could probably use /NODEFAULTLIB option and supply alternative (statically linked) implementation.

These are my "out of thin air" guesses though. So please ignore them if I don't know what I am talking about.

P.S. Your build script applies some "hacks" with a comment that they can be removed once the following pull request is merged into Bazel: bazelbuild/bazel#2599
Well, it was merged in March.

These are my "out of thin air" guesses though. So please ignore them if I don't know what I am talking about.

body:
As far as I understand msvcp140.dll is a 'generic' library (iostream, containers, etc.) So it won't be needed if the project was built using MinGW, for example.
Alternatively (if you prefer to stick to MS VC++ compiler) you could probably use `/NODEFAULTLIB` option and supply alternative (statically linked) implementation.

These are my "out of thin air" guesses though. So please ignore them if I don't know what I am talking about.

P.S. Your build script applies some "hacks" with a comment that they can be removed once the following pull request is merged into Bazel:  https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/2599
Well, it was merged in March.
